did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Controllers Office Records
did.abstract: A collection of graduate research proposals, property inventory, and memoranda and correspondence related to the Controller's Office of WSU from 1921-1964.

bioghist.p: The Office of Controller is the main financial office of Washington State University (formally State College of Washington). It receives and disburses all University funds. It is also responsible for keeping a record of all financial transactions and obligations.

scopecontent.p: Items in this collection include a bound collection of proposed graduate research projects from 1935; an inventory of all objects and property owned by the WSU (then known as the State College of Washington) from 1921; and various memoranda, correspondence, and reports related to the Association of Universities and Landgrant Colleges. Also includes reports relating to rural international development, and the Agency for International Development (AID) from 1964.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.
Items are in no particular order. The documents from 1921 and 1935 are in bound collections and are clearly indexed.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Controllers Office Records, 1921-1964 (UA1992-14)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by the Controllers Office on April 20, 1992 and retained as UA1992-14.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

controlaccess.corpname: Washington State University. Controllers Office -- Records and correspondence
